bow: daycare feeding infant sugary foods hi everyone our 12 month old has been going to daycare for about month so far we love our daycare but we are bit concerned about the food they are serving when we first started there they asked for list of food restrictions as she was under year we listed that salt and sugar be avoided as much as possible and stated that we are happy to send in homemade substitutes when necessary they assured us that they never include sugar or salt in the food that they provide we re not completely opposed to tiny bit of salt or sugar but also do want her eating junk as baby recently we have noticed that they have started serving her more and more food with excess amounts of sugar today they told me that they gave her the canned fruit salad that is in the sugar syrup before that they have given her cookies not the baby kind and flavoured yogurt let me say that am not completely anti sugar and will happily let her have some treats once she is bit older but feel like this is unnecessary for an infant just wanted to get other moms opinions on this and see if being irrational recently learned that zipcicles exist ziploc tubes was excited about frozen smoothie tubes but it would work just as well with greek yogurt mixed with bit of fruit spread no sugar added my son goes nuts for greek yogurt mixed with pomegranate spread your comment somehow made it click thanks for the idea just check the stonyfield website and it is not consistent with what you report oz baby yogurt has grams of sugar oz regular strawberry yogurt has 20 grams of sugar even if you correct for the weight the baby yogurt has 30 less sugar which may still be more sugar than you want they do post menu but there are lots of last minute substitutions which is usually where the junky food comes in so usually do know they will serve it until after the fact they have small supply of snacks ve sent which they ve been instructed to give if she ca have something and would send fresh fruit veggies if knew in advance guess should just start sending fresh snacks every day which is totally irritating based on the cost of this daycare checked the tubes at my store and the little individual tubs maybe thinking of the tubes but do remember it being much higher than the others do know about the tubes was just checking their website http www stonyfield com products removed my daycare has posted menu filled with protein whole grains and vegetables prepared on site you can see the kitchen working from the lobby each classroom also has snacks that they serve during the day if kids seem hungry or seem to be flagging but the snacks are fresh cut up fruit the teacher cuts it at the time of serving or crackers when he first started they served dessert every day after lunch but stopped that after he was there couple of months we give him handful of goldfish crackers or teddy grahams in the car on the way home since it 30 minute drive and that tides him over until dinner we rather he eat dehydrated fruit and offered it for while but he chucks that all over the car we started this when he was about 14 months honestly the food served at daycare kind of forced us to loosen up little at home which was bad thing he eats more fruit and vegetables at daycare he wo touch them at home one of the reasons we chose this daycare was because we were not happy at the ones that were catered because the menus were all processed foods chicken nuggets mac amp cheese etc his currently menu has things like honey garlic chicken brown rice and broccoli or beef medallion au jus with cauliflower and mashed potatoes and you can see the staff peeling potatoes in the kitchen preach the cost of daycare makes me feel like my child should be receiving the nectar of the gods exclusively the only flavored yogurts get my son are the stonyfield ones because they had less sugar than anything else could find yeah the yogurt stuff is crazy siggis yogurt is great because they minimize sugar though it costs little more but some of those other yogurts are just dessert that mom that sent picture of neon blue diarrhea puddles on my carpet to the daycare director they asked me for list of food my child could have and we ve updated it several times so expect them to follow the rules also not terribly picky about what my kid eats little sugar and food coloring is the worst that can happen but you have to let me know so do serve him juice and crunch berries for dinner would ask for menu for the week they should be able to provide you with that and then sub out what you do want baby to have offer to buy box of cherios and your own yogurt omg the sugar in yogurt switched to low fat plain and just serve it with fresh fruit and sometimes chia seeds think it is sour but my kids love it bonus is always have some plain yogurt to make quick tazitk did your daughter switch rooms when she turned my daughter started daycare at 18 months and we told the toddler room teacher that she should get juice with snack just water they did great job with that even to the point of being worried would be mad at them when she grabbed another kid juice and took drink then she turned and moved to the year old room the preference did get passed on and she got juice at that point it would have been lot harder to control and lot easier for her to know the difference open cups instead of sippy cups so we decided not to worry about the half cup of juice she gets once day on weekdays only maybe just remind them of what you had asked and reiterate that you are willing to bring food from home if they want as someone else posted maybe offer to bring box of non sugary cereal and some non flavored yogurt to substitute if they need it the fact that your daycare even offers juice makes me angry on your behalf it has no place in kid diet the cost of daycare barely covers the pittance of salary the majority of teachers are paid speaking of yogurt just want to chime in that due to the lebanese culture from my husband side we have always eaten plain whole fat yogurt laban it is all my kids knew yogurt wise as little ones and one of their first foods they do even like the other yogurts with sugar in them because they re used to the plain sometimes we put in crushed fruit but mostly they eat it plain we also put it on top of rice or scrambled eggs make cucumber yogurt sauce use it in other dips recipes and marinades and you can make buttermilk like drink by thinning with water and adding salt an acquired taste for sure notice that all of those uses are savory not sweet this sounds like primrose no arguments there teacher get the struggle early childhood folks do such an important service for our communities and yet get paid peanuts that said daycare still is huge expense for families the hope is if we re paying as much as our mortgage for daycare for one child they can feed them healthy food deleted it super bougie daycare used to work at one and it was comparable to the 30k private school my husband went to that scaled down obviously lol agree completely worked for primrose for while and made 50 an hour with college degree it was abysmal poster upthread mentioned that lot of the food the schools serve is regulated by the usda because of federal funding and that is accurate we used to get big boxes on monday of what was subsidized and it was always crap sounds like this daycare alright it funny my husband wants him to go to private school and it ll actually be cheaper than this daycare so far everyone is basically telling you to send in your own snacks while agree that would be solution it would be my first choice go have chat with the daycare teacher director about their food choices not being the healthiest options you do have to become confrontational just say hey you guys are great otherwise but this bugs me little can we talk about it find out *why* they are making unhealthy food choices is it convenience wo other kids eat healthier food do they recieve the food from the state or central organisation are they not well informed if you know where the problem is perhaps you can give them some suggestions to make this better or even help them out in some way if you ca get the regular program to be better than you can discuss how you can at least make sure your kid eats well for what it worth do think you are overreacting our pediatrician was very clear with our kids no sugar or salt before and very limited sugar and salt untill at least listened and did regret it ever signed mum whose kids think of fruit as treats what maniac would think you were weird for not giving your kids juice do people really not know how pointless and sugary it is this is what give my kids too and they do demand sugary crap because they do know it exists yet oh yeah have mom friend who is like serrrrriously we get or did before going dairy free whole fat greek yogurt and just mix in fruit puree my kid loves loves it actually did some math based on what the rates are at the different ranges how many kids enrolled estimate estimated salaries based on friends in the industry added in healthy amount for overhead and still came away with the owners making pretty penny but maybe live in an area of overpriced childcare here numbers using my own childcare experience at primrose infants 12 months and under were 225 week and there were six in the classroom so one classroom is collecting 1350 per week in tuition that class room had two teachers working 32 hours week after lunches and one working 20 hours week with no lunch so they were paying out 64 hours week in payroll at 11 50 an hour and 20 hours week at 50 an hour this meant that their payroll expenses alone were 926 leaving the daycare with 424 to cover the operating costs for the week in that room do think the overhead is nearly as big as you think it is children under are 1600 month children per teacher each of infant under 12 months and toddler 12 24 months for at total of 48 children full time teachers and part time teachers going to use your same payroll just for the sake of equality 6*40= 240 hours per week 11 50 hr 2760 3*20 60 hours per week 50 hr 570 total teacher payroll= 330 week total income per week 1600 4= 400 per week per child 400*48= 19 200 less payroll 15 900 so even if payroll is double that still and that just the under my center serve up through pre is that not full time center that is not enough teacher hours for that many children may be bit off on the total hours but even if you double it to 6k week payroll for just that age group that still over 10k per week left over they are open 6:30am to 6pm the full time teachers work 40 hours not sure how many hours the part times work think it varies they have some full time floaters that cover some of the hours and breaks and whatnot my mil thinks lucky charms are too sugary as long as my 1yo is eating the marshmallows ugh feel you on the juice my daughter has never and will never have juice and she almost get so much crap about it but it just sugar basically she eats lot of fruit so she does need juice your center may very well be greedy but do think it nearly as bad as you think 1600 month is actually 369 week because there are usually weeks in month 369 48 17712 48 kids ratio 11 hours per day 690 hours of childcare so let call it 10 50 hour and payroll is 7245 which does leave an impressive 10467 week leftover but they still have to pay for payroll tax which is probably 10 unemployment insurance workmans comp any benefits such as health insurance or paid time off janitorial building rent liability insurance supplies toys management salary etc also at daycares here some portion of the kids do not pay full tuition because of sibling discount or low income scholarship one preschool near me that seemed particularly greedy it turned out had gotten into really bad deal on renting their space do think you re being irrational at all the daycare preschool my son goes too is very very dead set against stuff like this never send lunchibles but the other kids get them so my son wants them too one day let him have one and you know they always come with some kind of candy or cookie the school told him he could eat it and had to wait until he got home so think lot of this is like culture thing at the school if talking to them does work and moving your kid to another center is an option just know that they are not all like that this really is good news our kids first taste of true junk food was when they started daycare when went back to work depressing when you ve worked so hard on their diet can you provide link or some examples of improvements thanks and very exciting know her last month she said to me wow how do you get your kids to eat fruit and she was speechless when also said they like vegetables just then my son chimed in with mommy love broccoli and peas it simple serve meals in courses first vegetables when they are hungriest then the protein usually chicken or fish last if they were good and ate all they get fresh fruit for dessert the fruit is treat they also always clear the vegetables and they have since they were eating solids before that actually remember they loved mashed peas usually water or whole milk to drink once in while we have juice in limited quantities one bit of side one of their absolute favorite baby foods was mashed sweet potato with butter salt and pumpkin pie spice which is cinnamon nutmeg ginger and couple others but it so easy to buy it in the spice container for pumpkin pie or apple pie which is the same minus ginger now for treat ll make the same but dice the sweet potato stir fry in coconut oil until soft with crispy outside and sprinkle with spice and salt it amazing the kids love it and it great treat how does she give her bowl but tell her not to eat the colorful ones doubt that happens she eating it all thank you for the info when my kid bit older will try it he 16 months and refuses basically everything except peanut butter off spoon strawberry yogurt smoothies graham crackers and water was planning on giving him way more vegetables but am settling for anything that puts weight on that he ll open his mouth for not the best diet but sjsu not the worst we have fruit calcium and plenty of protein just dry ones we were at sil house and her 18mo ate all the mallows so mil thought my daughter should get the rest said few times okay had enough or it almost bed time no more sugar or she wo sleep and then she would give her more literally until picked her up and took her to bed it depends if you re talking yobaby or yokids etc also they just announced they are cutting out all added sugar from their baby products in the near future in the same boat try not to be crazy about sugar because of reality but why introduce something unnecessarily my sons daycare has some not great snacks for while we were sending stuff from home for him to eat but them we eased up and said that school snacks were fine until realized that sometimes they got cookies nilla wafers and lemon cookies just told the teacher that the school snack was ok but no cookies so now they give kiddo fruit or plain cheerios would just be more specific with the daycare instructors and instead of saying not to much sugar which is open to interpretation give them clear guidelines which are easy to follow can you get copy of the menu then on days where the food is unhealthy can you send food we do that with our daughter and we try to send pretty easy things like yogurt or veggies
